review_text: This cabin is really special, cozy and serene. We wanted to be secluded without being remote and this location is perfect. The hosts are gracious, responsive and friendly. The television was perfect for my husband’s evening sports fix and we didn’t miss internet because the cell phone service was fantastic. There are many brochures available if you need ideas about activities and I appreciated the map. We went to Lincoln’s Boyhood Home Memorial and West Baden Springs Resort along with a lot of antiquing. This cabin is perfectly located for so many southern Indiana day trips. We just loved it and will definitely return. Upon leaving we did meet Jerry and he regaled us with some history of the cabin and the land, making it even more special.

Amazing stay in a wonderful 200-year-old colonial style house. The house is surrounded by the woods, streams, trails, ponds, and old stone structures of Avoca Park. We loved having coffee on the back porch, listening to the spring-fed creek. Jan and Chase were very responsive on the site. Avoca is a nice small town. Groceries and restaurants are less than 10 minutes away in Bedford.
The house has lots of room. Our group of seven was able to spread out. There are several comfortable gathering places in the downstairs rooms. The inside is clean, bright and freshly painted. They did a fantastic job restoring it. The house has updated furniture, decorations, and new linens and appliances alongside the 19th/20th century charm.
We made a day trip to Spring Mill State Park that really rounded out the visit, as we learned more about the Hamer family in the museum there. At the end of each day we walked along the ponds and watched the sun set over the woods. Can’t wait to return!
